text:
="preserve">Image:Ford Country Squire front.jpg|thumb|A Ford Country Squire station wagon
Image:1980s Pontiac Safari.jpg|thumb|A 1989 Pontiac Safari station wagon
The station wagon, or estate, is a variant of sedan. The difference between station wagons and regular sedans is that the station wagon has no trunk, plus the roofs are extended backwards over a shared passenger or cargo volume with access in the back.
Station wagons have been mostly replaced by minivans/MPVs, SUVs, and crossovers.

annotations.surface_form: A Ford Country Squire station wagon
